channel.title: OR Rules :: CIS 301 Textbook
channel.description: In this section, we will see the deduction rules for the OR operator. OR introduction If we know that a proposition P is true, then it will also be the case that both P ∨ Q and Q ∨ P are also true. It doesn’t matter what Q is – it might even be something that is know to be false. Because P is true, it will make the overall OR statement true as well.
